website_summaries.verdict: An affordable glove for infield training drills.
pros: Pancake style makes the glove ideal for infield training drills
Leather shell guarantees the glove is constructed to last
Helps a ballplayer master the glove-to-throw transition
cons: Intended for infield training drills only

customer_reviews.title: Better ShortStop
customer_reviews.text: My daughter plays softball and I needed to find a solid pancake glove when I hit her groundballs. I've seen cheaper ones fall apart from poor construction and flat out didn't get the job done. This has been a great investment. Her glove position is so much better with the time we've put in using this glove. She naturally move her feet to the ball and quick exchanges to the throw.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bush

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality for the price. Stiffer than the foam pads and will definitely outlast them. No comparison between these and the foam in regards to durability. Feels like a glove and makes drills more fun. Everyone in the family can use it m, kids or adult. Highly recommend and wish I would have bought sooner. Definitely took my kids catching and fielding to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool for kids and infield practice.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, appears well made. Son loves using it for practicing grounders, and it is improving his using 2hands technique. Will use in practice for kids needing to improve technique
customer_reviews.author: tdogger

customer_reviews.title: I love using the training gloves for infield drills
customer_reviews.text: I love using the training gloves for infield drills, and find the leather outlasts the plastic/foam version. As well, ball comes off it more naturally.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Got it to help with kiddos baseball team!
customer_reviews.text: Works just how I wanted it to work and to teach the kids on how to get in front of the ball and to pick it up next to you! As well as using both hands instead of the baseball glove itself! Taught exactly what I needed it too!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bellemore

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, period.
customer_reviews.text: The glove is made of a terrible quality and smaller than what it looks. It cant fit my 11-yr old son. Just dont buy. Also, the company who sells it OJCommerce gave me a really hard time to return it, just one day after I had purchase. They asked me to pay for shipping costs, it’s insane nowadays.
customer_reviews.author: Preppypreppy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I previously used the SKLZ Soft Hands foam paddle. This is a step up and is worth the extra money. Doesn't "close" like some other soft hands trainers I've seen. Adjustable velcro strap makes it a good fit for kids or adults.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product for players at any level
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product that's helpful for any level player. This product is good quality, stays flat, is much sturdier than some of the floppy gloves by other brands, has the right amount of cushion to it. My 11 year old got into a bad habit of putting his throwing hand over his head until the ball was in his glove. It took him a few minutes to get the hang of it but after a short time practicing with this glove his form looked like a professional as it gives instant feedback. I'm a very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: JGram147

customer_reviews.title: You have to actually practice with it to benefit from it. Buying it isn’t enough.
customer_reviews.text: Well I hear these are helpful. My son wanted to get better at using two hands and doing grounders. I don’t think using this glove was effective as getting less play time.
customer_reviews.author: Dyana

customer_reviews.title: Small but effective
customer_reviews.text: It’s smaller than my Wilson pancake by anim inch or so. Light as feathers but stiff as a board. Comfortable fingers slots. It’s a good switch up if you have a bigger pancake, it really shows up on the field when you have your fielding glove on.
customer_reviews.author: Earl T. Dynamite

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Use it for most infield warm up practices with my Youth Team. Awesome training tool, I got it at a great price and couldn’t be more happier with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Will help your kid field better.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for helping them use 2 hands, takes a little while to get used to. Seems to be good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Lincoln V

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick ball transfer
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. It has a slight depression and a nice leather feel. Every player needs to practice with a flat glove.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Great little glove for drilling field work. I work the kids with hands only then to this then to their regular glove. Big improvements already.
customer_reviews.author: N. Golden

customer_reviews.title: great training tool
customer_reviews.text: A really nice tool for young kids to train them to get in the right position and use both hand to field ground balls.
customer_reviews.author: RMR

customer_reviews.title: Best value. Quality very good
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for a year. Work perfectly. Best value. Quality very good. Only works for righty. My lefty fielder (always have 1 or two) either catches with backside of her glove, or uses the cheaper foam flat glove I also have.
customer_reviews.author: full-4ce

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my little league softball and baseball players
customer_reviews.text: Not the thickest training glove I've used but works as it should and hard to beat the price point. Perfect for my little league softball and baseball players.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: We use this most. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Perfect for training with my daughter for softball.
customer_reviews.author: Ashbrooke

customer_reviews.title: Not enough padding
customer_reviews.text: Not very good padding. You definitely feel the sting of the ball. Didn't blow me away. It works well for catch and easy ground balls.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TRAINING TOOL.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made product. No need to waste money on "heart of the hide" or the upscale models. This one works perfectly, more than happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Hogue

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 7 year old. Great little glove for drilling field work.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian & Christina

customer_reviews.title: Part of practice routine
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this for the first half of fielding practice. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Drallam

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for making quality
customer_reviews.text: Don't hesitate like I did. Way better than a foam version by other companies. This is built to last and worth every dime. I saw immediate results in transition work too.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Great way to train kids the catching wheel. Places focus on footwork and glove placement. Kids have a lot if fun with this drill. We use it in the living room with whiffle balls and outdoors with baseballs.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: Great value, worth it
customer_reviews.text: Good fit and sturdy. Worth paying for versus the foam pads. We carry to tournaments and use between games
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for getting for basic skills. Glove on ground and other hand on top.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This works great. The youth baseball team I coach had some ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great. The youth baseball team I coach had some of the skilz padded ones....we used them but there wasn't much enthusiasm. The kids love these. Great price!
customer_reviews.author: crazedhawk

customer_reviews.title: Great mitt for the price
customer_reviews.text: Unbeatable price for the quality, and it fits on both my hand and my child's with no issues. This is a perfect mitt for working on the fundamentals of catching and fielding.
customer_reviews.author: wes

customer_reviews.title: Nice for using in drills ( short hops)
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant at first, but overall i had a good time using it. working on using that top hand during drills. GREAT product!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very good training device, good for eye hand coordination training.
customer_reviews.author: Arun Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Use them during our throwing warm ups for infielding to expediate a quick transfer and the kids love using them
customer_reviews.text: True leather training glove that doesnt hurt your hands. Use them during our throwing warm ups for infielding to expediate a quick transfer and the kids love using them. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: Great training aid
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product!!!! If you take the time to teach your kids how to do fielding correctly it will only allow them to advance farther.
customer_reviews.author: Bob the builder

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for young infielders
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived for my 11-year-old son -- love it! Forces you to learn solid fundamentals on fielding ground balls -- get there early, watch the ball into your glove, use two hands, etc. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Altobello

customer_reviews.title: Good aid that forces proper fundamentals
customer_reviews.text: Great training aid. Took to practice several times and all of the dads and most of the kids wanted to run drills using it.
customer_reviews.author: d. ward

customer_reviews.title: Good glove to do drills
customer_reviews.text: When doing soft hand drills gloves worked perfect & easy for girls fo remove for other player to use sharing four gloves on rapid drills..
customer_reviews.author: Marty Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great price for quality
customer_reviews.text: Great pancake glove with great quality. For the price of this glove it is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Performs exactly as expected. Good tool to reinforce solid techniques. I would buy again. Would give 5 stars if it worked on both hands.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: GOOD QUALITY TRAINING GLOVE
customer_reviews.text: Glove works great! Every infielder needs this glove to improve their speed & accuracy of handling the softball. After one weekend of practicing with this glove, my daughter is noticeably faster retrieving & throwing the ball.
customer_reviews.author: Wren

customer_reviews.title: Useful and well made
customer_reviews.text: Great for infielders to work on ground balls. Must use two hands, out in front.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Nice Material
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made with quality material. You can hit a decent grounder without worrying if the glove will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Man

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great training tool. Son loves it to challenge himself with making out of the ordinary catches. I recommend. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Ed

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This was very reasonably priced training glove compared to its competitors and the quality is higher than I expected. We don't use it everyday, but it looks like it should last for a long, long time.
customer_reviews.author: G. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect for my 9 year old son he loves it !! Good product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Good glove for fielding practice
customer_reviews.text: Both my 11 year old and 8 year old sons have been practicing with this glove. They both think it has improved their fielding skills.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Great Pancake Glove
customer_reviews.text: This pancake glove was the perfect addition to my 10 year-old little league training arsenal. We had a number of boys that were struggling with fielding ground balls cleanly. The pancake glove helps remove the reliance on a flexible glove, and forces the players to use both hands. The glove fit my 10 year-old. Coaches tried it for purposes of demonstration, and it also fit adult hands. Price-wise, this was the most affordable of the training/pancake gloves out there, and it worked just great. I see no need to spend more money on a higher-priced version.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Kaski

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised. Used same day delivery and got it right away
customer_reviews.author: Steve V

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tool
customer_reviews.text: Forces kids to use proper technique in fielding ground balls.
customer_reviews.author: Weylan M.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you paid for.
customer_reviews.text: Best training glove I've found for the price. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: leonard

customer_reviews.title: Great for training
customer_reviews.text: Great for training, but its for small kids hands and not 11+.
customer_reviews.author: John Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent deal compared to buying at a B+M. Excellent training aide.
customer_reviews.author: DSLR Shooter

customer_reviews.title: Great Training Glove
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. Most lefties play 1st, pitch or outfield. Why would you need this for a lefty? My son has gotten better after a day of playing on his own (throwing a ball to the wall). He is forced to move & breakdown to the ball instead of just running & scooping blindly. The construction of the glove is good. Not too heavy or too thin like foam trainers.
customer_reviews.author: Anem

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A+A+A+ perfect for honing infielding skills...ball focus & glove to throw hand transition.
customer_reviews.author: SikWitiT Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my grandson and he loves it. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Guzman

customer_reviews.title: Good Training Tool
customer_reviews.text: Looking forward to using this at little league practice. It's small size is perfect for my ball player. This should definitely help with his ball handling.
customer_reviews.author: Ahpets

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for teaching to use two hand and the timing of the second hand.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: i love it..my son HATES it
customer_reviews.text: son has to be threated with punishment to use this mitt. he 's just 5 and just hates it ! he 's far more interested in his idea of ''accomplishment" as in catching and actually being able to do ANYTHING with it. i highly recomend it because my son is getting good at catching behind the plate ...and does nt have a clue why. its a great tool of disipline.
customer_reviews.author: paulpanchula

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This pancake glove is absolutely awesome! It has worked very well to help drive home the method of using two hands while fielding letting my 10 year old son get the ball out of his glove quicker. When a 1/10 of a second could make the difference between an out or safe, this is working perfect! Quick hands equal quick throws.
customer_reviews.author: Night Train Rider

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. It is made very well.. Just as good as Mizuno Brand and half the price.GREAT PURCHASE. I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: jenae

customer_reviews.title: Great training glove
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed. Velcro adjustment for small hands. Daughter loves it. Great training glove!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hartenstein

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: a tired and true aid for teaching proper technique for fielding a ground ball
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. My son and I use it daily
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My son and I use it daily. Very well made and a great tool. My son was a first baseman for 5 years and switch to second for 13 and then mid season switched to ss and this tool really helped him stay down on the ball and make the adjustment very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Dore33

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a product to help with infielding, this is it. I don't think there is a better tool for teaching good infielding techniques and this glove does the job. It is the same quality as a regular infielder glove (very Nice) and fits the hand well. I coach a 16u travel softball team and this is my favorite practice tool.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: This glove works freat for teaching fielder to catch with ...
customer_reviews.text: This glove works great for teaching fielders to catch with 2 hands. Also beneficial for learning quick ball transfer to throwing hand. Wish they also made a lefty glove for kids I coach.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: I bought this glove to help my 8 year old son with fielding. It is working like a charm and he is enjoying the practice. It is built to last. Also it is adjustable. He is a smaller 8yro and I was worried it wouldn't fit but it does. It also will fit my adult sized hand after Adjusting the strap.
customer_reviews.author: tr

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: my son needed this and I'm glad I found a good quality one that is priced right.
customer_reviews.author: louie villegas jr

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Great practice tool. Solid quality and price. Looks like it will hold up. I would buy it again. Mcgreggor is a good brand
customer_reviews.author: Tech

customer_reviews.title: softball coach
customer_reviews.text: it does its job teaches my girls to not flick their gloves and two fieled with two hands in order to make it faster transfer to the throw seems to me made fairly well
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: He says it's way better than the foam one I first got him
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this thing. He says it's way better than the foam one I first got him.
customer_reviews.author: Gil

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!!!
customer_reviews.text: I looked everywhere for a reasonable priced pancake glove. Needed one in a hurry as well. Found this one on Amazon, ordered it the same day and received it in 2 days thanks to my prime shipping. Very well made for the price and my sons outfielding has improved considerably!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and fit. Versatile enough for a 7 year old to use or an adult. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle Romanelli

customer_reviews.title: Great aide
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for getting both hands involved in the catch and throw.Less errors,more throw outs!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Baumbach

customer_reviews.title: Right hand throw only
customer_reviews.text: Am torn on whether to give more stars as it seems like great value as compared to pricier leather alternatives. Assumed this was an ambidextrous glove as there was no option to specify right or left. The cheaper foam skillz version states that explicitly. If you need a left hand throw leather then look at the Mizuno. I went with the cheaper foam Skillz option and returned this.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Swank

product_meta.title: MacGregor Infield Training Glove
product_meta.description: . "Pancake" style glove is ideal for infield training. Aids in developing a quick "glove to throw" transition. Leather construction ..
feature_bullets: "Pancake" style glove is ideal for infield training
Aids in developing a quick "glove to throw" transition
